metadata.title: mozilla: CSP strict-dynamic bypass using web-compatibility shims (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Firefox adds web-compatibility shims in place of some tracking scripts blocked by Enhanced Tracking Protection.  On a site protected by Content Security Policy in "strict-dynamic" mode, an attacker able to inject an HTML element could have used a DOM Clobbering attack on some of the shims and achieved XSS, bypassing the CSP strict-dynamic protection. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 129, Firefox ESR < 115.14, and Firefox ESR < 128.1. 
            STATEMENT: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
firefox is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
